attributes.action: ensure that MPs do not decide their own salary/pension increases.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
MPs have voted themselves huge pay increases over the last 10 years. Their arguement that this gets the best candidates does not hold water. Parliament has had excellent MPs in the past who did it for the public service and not for money. Now we are led to believe that politicans who accepted the salary when they joined Parliament have awarded themselves huge pay increases now just to ensure that people in future will think about becoming a MP. 
Any salary/pension increase for MPs must be controlled by a totally independant group which cannot be influenced by the Prime Minister in any way.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
